page.title: 14Public House In Whitley
page.content: There are four public houses in our D-Block.Their names are The Chetwode Arms, The Birch and Bottle, The Mill- Stone and the Antrobus Arms. The Chetwode Arms has been an inn for over 400 years,and served for centuries as a coaching stop on the main Shrewsbury Road. The stables are still being used as storerooms. Originally the name was "The Cock of Whitley" until Sir John Chetwode renamed the house around l700 after his family, as it was then part of the estate. The Millstone used to be a windmill and the house next to it was built for the miller. Austin Wood- vine is the Landlord, they sell beer, spirits and wine. It has always been called the Millstone.It was built in l890.The Birch and Bottle has 12 to 14 people on a part-time basis. The Land- lord is Ian Holt.The Antrobus Arms changed its name from The Wheatsheaf.
